proposed_strategy.name: Single Adhyaya Chunk
proposed_strategy.description: The entire provided document constitutes the Fourth Adhyaya (Chapter) and its commentary. Since the total character count is well below the safety limit, the entire chapter is processed as a single chunk to minimize API calls.

execution_plan.description: The entirety of the Fourth Adhyaya of the Kausitaki Brahmana Upanishad, including Sri Rangarammanuja Muni's Prakashika commentary (Mantras 1-45).

parsing_instructions.justification: The Adhyaya is fundamentally divided into individual Mantras (verses), which are the smallest discrete units of source text followed by their respective commentary (Prakashika).

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra block begins with the Sanskrit verse text, which is reliably identified as ending with a serial number enclosed in double vertical bars.
examples: स होवाच बालाकिः, ‘य एवैष आदित्ये पुरुषः, तमेवाहमुपासे इति’ ॥ ५ ॥

end_pattern.description: The end of the parsing segment is implicitly the start of the next Mantra. For the final unit, look for the concluding markers of the chapter or the commentary.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Treat all text occurring before the first numbered Mantra (Mantra 1) as prefatory or chapter metadata (e.g., titles, commentator names, and the Adhyaya heading).
